cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles SE of St. Croix
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the Greater Antilles, then forecast to enter the Gulf of Mexico and curve northwest toward the Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (likely between Port Fourchon and Lake Charles, near South Louisiana port complex)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None at this time across Gulf Coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: None at this time across Gulf Coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas to Mississippi, with greatest focus on coastal Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Potential for sustained tropical-storm-force winds (39–58 mph) at the port late 25–26 Aug; 21 % cumulative probability.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early guidance suggests 3–6 ft surge possible along south-central Louisiana coast, including approaches to the Port of South Louisiana, if Laura reaches hurricane strength.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall totals of 4–8 inches possible with localized higher amounts, creating flash-flood risk in the port vicinity.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Possible river flooding, elevated waves/seas in Lower Mississippi River, and port operation disruptions or closures.
